name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Currently, Weibo has begun to block the content of this letter. Some pictures sent by netizens cannot be displayed.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On September 20, Zhang Qingfang, a well-known criminal defense lawyer and a doctor of criminal law at Peking University, had his lawyer license revoked.
Lawyer Zhang Qingfang responded: "I gladly accept this historical honor."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On September 20, Guangchang No. 1 Middle School in Fuzhou City, Jiangxi Province, forced all students to fill out an application form, voluntarily and "begging" the school to resume evening self-study and Saturday and Sunday after-school care services. Students who were unwilling to fill out the form would be threatened with suspension of classes by calling their parents. Some students reported the matter to the Education Bureau, and the reporting students were subsequently dealt with by the school.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Headlines of major official newspapers on September 21.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Recently, Beijing issued the "Notice on the Issuance of Reward Fees (5 Yuan) for Parents of Only Children in 2024". Couples who hold an Only Child Honor Certificate and whose only child is under the age of 18 will each receive a reward of 5 yuan per month.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On September 21, Kuaishou announced that it would take action against related illegal activities such as spreading content that incited confrontation between China and Japan, and a total of more than 90 illegal accounts were dealt with.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On September 21, Puning School Affiliated to South China Normal University held a symposium for parent representatives. The big screen at the meeting displayed "Anyone who dares to speak ill of the school will be attacked by the whole group. Internal problems should be solved internally, and no one else is allowed to make irresponsible remarks." "Read the content of the school's official account with your children and talk about the school's outstanding achievements."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: According to news on September 20, China's unemployment rate for the 16-24 year old workforce, excluding students, rose to 18.8% in August, the highest since data was available.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Recently, it was reported online that Huang Ruyi, deputy director of the Sichuan Provincial Rural Energy Development Center, made inappropriate remarks in a group, such as "What's the big deal about killing a child? Japan's American daddy kills hundreds every day" and "Our discipline is to kill Japanese".

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: It was reported on September 20 that a Hong Kong man made a video using the Cultural Revolution phrase "Revolution is not a crime, rebellion is justified" and uploaded it to social media platforms for propaganda. He was charged by the authorities with "knowingly publishing a publication with seditious intent" in accordance with Article 23 of the Basic Law (Safeguarding National Security Ordinance) and was sentenced to 14 months in prison by the West Kowloon Magistrates' Courts today.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On September 20, China announced that it would gradually resume imports of Japanese aquatic products. However, just last month, some netizens said, "Whoever dares to lift the ban is the public enemy of the Chinese people and deserves death."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 20, Luoyang, Henan. During a break in the court session that morning, defense lawyer Zeng Wu discovered that signal blockers were installed not only at the court scene but also in the lawyers’ lounge area, making it impossible to make calls. When lawyer Zeng Wu tried to turn off the blocker, it was not securely installed and fell off the wall with just a touch. As a result, the lawyer was summoned and taken away by the Luoyang police for intentional damage to property.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On September 20, during the UN Security Council's urgent review of the situation in Lebanon, Fu Cong said that China was deeply shocked by the fact that thousands of Lebanese communication equipment such as pagers and walkie-talkies were remotely controlled and exploded at the same time, causing thousands of casualties. The use of remotely controlled communication tools to launch indiscriminate attacks and cause large-scale civilian casualties is unprecedented in history and is outrageous.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 20, Shanghai. A man was fined 200 yuan and deducted 3 points for smoking while driving. The man collapsed and shouted, "I only earn 300 yuan a day, and you fined me 200 yuan for smoking a cigarette."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
September 21, Zhengzhou.
Henan fans and Chengdu fans clashed violently before the game. Someone threw cold fireworks at the scene

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 20 news: China's tax revenue fell 5.3% from January to August, and non-tax revenue increased 11.7%

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: https://t.co/pIau85aSDn

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 19, Huzhou, Zhejiang. A netizen posted a video saying that he was leading a tour group of dozens of veterans, and when they were queuing for a boat at the tourist channel of Xiazhuhu National Wetland Park, a "leader" with a group of Japanese tourists asked them to go through the tourist channel first. This caused dissatisfaction among other tourists. "The leader replied that the Japanese guests had booked a boat and would not affect other tourists."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On September 20, Luo Xiang, a professor at China University of Political Science and Law, released a video in which he used the name-changing incident of the Aisin-Gioro royal family to discuss hatred and right and wrong. “Compared to asking others to change themselves, cultivate personal morality, love others as themselves, have less hatred, and respect people as human beings may be more important.” Many netizens questioned whether Luo Xiang was whitewashing Japan and taking money from the Japanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 20, Anyang, Henan. A man posted a video saying that he was originally a policeman. In 2019, when he was investigating a case, Deputy Director Zhang Yunhai handled the case for personal favors and did not agree to use technical means. He asked to wait for the suspect to surrender, which led to the suspect being arrested by other units. He was also blamed for this and was sentenced to two years in prison for dereliction of duty. Currently, he can only work on construction sites to make a living.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 20 (Released) Zhengzhou, Henan. Urban management officers worked together to push the snack cart onto a cart and took it away. The vendor stepped forward to stop them but was pinned to the ground by the urban management officers. The person filming nearby was also told by the urban management officers not to take photos.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 21 (Released) A man wearing a hat with a rising sun flag on it was yelled at by passers-by, "Do you know what this flag symbolizes? I'm a veteran. If you wear this again, I'll beat you up. Get lost!"

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 20, Xuchang, Henan. The Sunac Guanhe Chenyuan project was left unfinished, and the owners were forced to move into the unfinished building without water or electricity. Not only did they fail to wait for justice and fairness, but they were instead subjected to a large number of police for stability maintenance and expulsion.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 20, Suzhou, Anhui. There have been heavy rains in Suzhou recently, and the river water has risen. When the river was releasing floodwaters, many netizens took photos of a sightseeing boat floating down the river on the bank of Tuohe River, hitting the bridge pier and instantly shattering. The photographer, Mr. Ge, said that because of the rain, water from a county town above was leaking down, the boat's rope broke, and the boat floated down with the flood and hit the bridge. The boat was private and there was no one on board.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On the afternoon of September 21, some netizens received text messages from the People's Procuratorate of Guangdong Province and the Guangzhou Military Procuratorate, which reminded them that it was prohibited to photograph military restricted areas and interfere with the operations of warships.
